StreetFighter2017

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • StreetFighter2017.GameBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GameBoard
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Runnable
    Author:
    iDVID this class represents the graphic output of the game and the functions to make changes on it
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void gameOver()
      checks who lost the game, places the name of the winner in the winner String, makes the game over, starts the falling function for the loser, runs the sounds that are needed when the game is over
      void hit(int fighterNumber, int HPLoose)
      subtracts the amount of hit points that the player looses after a hit 1 by 1
      void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
      adds the key code of the key that have been pressed to the array list of the keys that are pressed and than if the game is not over it checks if this array has moving keys in it and if it has it makes the player move if he can
      void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
      removes the key code of the key that have been released from the array list of the keys that are pressed and than if the game is not over it checks if this key code is of a moving key if it is it makes the player stop moving, if the key code is of an action, if the player can make that action, it will make the player do that action
      void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt) 
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      the main function, runs when the class starts, builds up the first frame and board
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      paints the board on the frame
      void powerDown(int fighterNumber, int amountOfPower)
      subtracts the amount of power that the player looses after a hit all at once
      void powerUp(int fighterNumber, int amountOfPower)
      adds the amount of power that the player gains after a hit 1 by 1
      void refresh()
      creates a new frame with a new game board in it
      void run()
      runs the moving functions on the players if the booleans are true, checks if its not game over and also repaints the board so the pictures will keep changing, and it does this until the frame is closed
      static javax.swing.ImageIcon shrinkIcon(int width, int hight, javax.swing.ImageIcon i)
      changes the height and width of a picture

        public void powerDown(int fighterNumber,
                      int amountOfPower)
        subtracts the amount of power that the player looses after a hit all at once
        Parameters:
        fighterNumber - : the number of the fighter that needs to loose from his power
        amountOfPower - : the amount of power that the player needs to loose

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver()
        checks who lost the game, places the name of the winner in the winner String, makes the game over, starts the falling function for the loser, runs the sounds that are needed when the game is over

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
        adds the key code of the key that have been pressed to the array list of the keys that are pressed and than if the game is not over it checks if this array has moving keys in it and if it has it makes the player move if he can
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        evt - : a KeyEvent of the key that is pressed

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
        removes the key code of the key that have been released from the array list of the keys that are pressed and than if the game is not over it checks if this key code is of a moving key if it is it makes the player stop moving, if the key code is of an action, if the player can make that action, it will make the player do that action
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        evt - : a KeyEvent of the key that is released

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • run

        public void run()
        runs the moving functions on the players if the booleans are true, checks if its not game over and also repaints the board so the pictures will keep changing, and it does this until the frame is closed
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
